activities: Data is collected exclusively from public sources (most maintained by US Government) and analyzed using social network analysis techniques. These techniques imply connections between people based on collaboration using public records.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Authorship and co-authorship information collected from publicly available sources in the life sciences domain. A scoring system that derives from presence or absence of coauthorship in journals is processed.
recoursemech: Commitment to cooperate with data protection authorities (DPAs) located in the European Union and Switzerland or their authorized representatives.
